page.title: 08SHOPPING & TRADE IN SALTBURN
page.content: In 1983 a new supermarket was opened in Saltburn. By 1985 this had had a marked effect on the way people shopped. A survey showed us that the majority of people in Saltburn used the supermarket and felt it was needed. In fact it was the first large supermarket to open in the town. Some elderly people thought it had spoilt the town's image even though it offered a wide range of cheap goods. Fresh foods were not popular and could be bought at local markets. The future of Saltburn's smaller shops remains uncertain and several of them have already closed. Many thought there was still a need for more specialized shops although they understood the problems that faced owners who could not compete with supermarket prices and the variety of specialist shops in nearby Redcar and Middlesbrough.
